sen.j: 八幡堀（はちまんぼり）は、滋賀県近江八幡市にある幅員約15メートル、全長6キロメートルに及ぶ運河である。
sen.e: Hachiman-bori Canal is located in Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture, and measures approximately 15m wide and 6km long.
Hachiman-bori Canal is located in Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture, and measures approximately 15m wide and 6km long.
Hachiman-bori Canal is located in Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture, and measures approximately 15m wide and 6km long.

sen.j: 安土桃山時代に豊臣秀次が八幡城を築城した際、城下町の都市計画として整備され、城を防御する軍事的な役割と琵琶湖の水運（当時の物流の要）を利用する商業的役割を兼ね備えた。
sen.e: When Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI built Yawata-jo Castle during Azuchi-Momoyama Period, the canal was built as part of development of a castle town to serve both the military function of castle defense and the commercial function of water transport in the Lake Biwa area (as a logistics center during the period).

When Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI built Yawata-jo Castle during the Azuchi-Momoyama Period, the canal was built as part of development of a castle town to serve both the military function of castle defense and the commercial function of water transport in the Lake Biwa area (as a logistics center during the period).

When Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI built Yawata-jo Castle during the Azuchi-Momoyama Period, the canal was built as part of development of a castle town to serve both the military function of castle defense and the commercial function of water transport in the Lake Biwa area (as a logistics center during the period).

sen.j: 江戸時代には、近江商人（八幡商人）による町の発展に大きな役割を果たした。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, it contributed to the development of the city by the merchants of Hachiman.
In the Edo Period, it contributed to the development of the city by Omi shonin (Omi merchants), i.e. Hachiman shonin (Hachiman merchant).
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。the merchants of Hachiman → Omi shonin (Omi merchants), Hachiman shonin (Hachiman merchant)
sen.e: In the Edo Period, it contributed to the development of the city by Omi shonin (Omi merchants), i.e. Hachiman shonin (Hachiman merchant).

sen.j: 堀沿いには白壁の土蔵や旧家が建ち並び、「近江八幡市八幡伝統的建造物群保存地区」として「新町通り」・｢永原町通り｣・「日牟禮八幡宮境内地」と共に重要伝統的建造物群保存地区に選定されている。
sen.e: The canal is lined with storehouses with white earth and mortar walls and merchant homes and is designated part of Omi Hachiman City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Hachiman Buildings, together with Shinmachi-dori, Nagahara-cho dori and Himure-hachimangu Shrine.

The canal is lined with storehouses with white earth and mortar walls and merchant homes and is designated as a part of 'Omi Hachiman City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Hachiman Buildings,' together with 'Shinmachi-dori,' 'Nagahara-cho dori' and 'Himure-hachimangu Shrine.'
sen.cmt: ' 'を追加しました。 As a を追加しました。
sen.e: The canal is lined with storehouses with white earth and mortar walls and merchant homes and is designated as a part of 'Omi Hachiman City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Hachiman Buildings,' together with 'Shinmachi-dori,' 'Nagahara-cho dori' and 'Himure-hachimangu Shrine.'

sen.j: 1585年（天正13年）、四国征伐で軍功を挙げた豊臣秀次は、近江43万石を与えられ、八幡山に八幡城を築城し、城下町を開町した。
sen.e: With military success in the Shikoku Conquest in 1585, Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI was given Omi, a 430,000-koku fief (feudal domain estimated to produce 2.15 million bushels of rice annually), where he built the Hachiman Castle in Mt. Hachiman and opened a castle town.

With military success in the Shikoku Conquest in 1585, Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI was given Omi, a 430,000-koku fief (feudal domain estimated to produce 2.15 million bushels of rice annually), where he built the Hachiman Castle in Mt. Hachiman and opened a castle town.

With military success in the Shikoku Conquest in 1585, Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI was given Omi, a 430,000-koku fief (feudal domain estimated to produce 2.15 million bushels of rice annually), where he built the Hachiman Castle in Mt. Hachiman and opened a castle town.

sen.j: その際、湖畔を埋め立て、八幡山周囲に八幡堀を開削した。
sen.e: In the development project, the lakeside area was reclaimed, and Hachiman-bori Canal was dug around Mt. Hachiman.
In the development project, the lakeside area was reclaimed, and Hachiman-bori Canal was dug around Mt. Hachiman.
In the development project, the lakeside area was reclaimed, and Hachiman-bori Canal was dug around Mt. Hachiman.

sen.j: 自由商業都市を目指し安土城下などの商人・職人を呼び寄せ、碁盤上に区切った城下町に居住区を設けた。
sen.e: In the drive to create a free commercial town, he encouraged merchants and artisans living close to Azuchi-jo Castle to relocate and created a residential area that was divided into squares.
In the drive to create a free commercial town, he encouraged merchants and artisans living close to Azuchi-jo Castle to relocate and created a residential area that was divided into squares.
In the drive to create a free commercial town, he encouraged merchants and artisans living close to Azuchi-jo Castle to relocate and created a residential area that was divided into squares.

sen.j: 堀の北側を武士、南側を町人の居住区域とし、さらに、町人の居住区の西を商人、東北を職人の居住区とした。
sen.e: Samurai families were to live on the north side of the canal, and the common folk were to be located on the south side, which was divided further, with merchants on the western part of the area and artisans on the northeastern side.

Samurai families were to live on the north side of the canal, and the common folk were to be located on the south side, which was divided further, with merchants on the western part of the area and artisans on the northeastern side.

Samurai families were to live on the north side of the canal, and the common folk were to be located on the south side, which was divided further, with merchants on the western part of the area and artisans on the northeastern side.

sen.j: 堀は、八幡城の防衛と湖上交通による物流の役割を兼ね備え、城下町の発展・繁栄に大きく寄与した。
sen.e: The canal served both as defense for Hachiman Castle and also as a route for transportation in Lake Biwa, contributing hugely to the growth and prosperity of the town.
The canal served both as defense for Hachiman Castle and also as a route for transportation in Lake Biwa, contributing hugely to the growth and prosperity of the town.
The canal served both as defense for Hachiman Castle and also as a route for transportation in Lake Biwa, contributing hugely to the growth and prosperity of the town.

sen.j: 1595年（文禄4年）、秀次自害により八幡城は廃城になったが、城下町は存続し、近江商人により繁栄を極めた。
sen.e: Although the castle was closed in 1595 with Hidetsugu committing suicide, the town continued to thrive, reaching a peak of prosperity with commercial operations of the Omi merchants.
Although the castle was closed in 1595 with Hidetsugu committing suicide, the town continued to thrive, reaching a peak of prosperity with commercial operations of the Omi merchants.
Although the castle was closed in 1595 with Hidetsugu committing suicide, the town continued to thrive, reaching a peak of prosperity with commercial operations of the Omi merchants.

sen.j: 近江商人は八幡堀の地の利を活かし、地場産物（畳表、蚊帳、米、酒など）を陸路や水路を利用して各地へ搬出し、各地の産物を持ち帰り、再び各地へ送り出すといった「諸国産物回し」と呼ばれる商法によって、各地の産業振興に貢献した。
sen.e: Taking advantage of Hachiman-bori Canal's geographical advantage, Omi merchants adopted a trade scheme called "Shokoku Bussan Mawashi (circulation of goods among regions)" in which they shipped local goods (tatami straw mats, mosquito nets, rice, rice wine and others) via land and water and returned with goods from other regions, which in turn were shipped elsewhere, and through this cycle contributed to industrial development in various parts of the country.
sen.cmt: 諸国産物回し: Shokoku Bussan Mawashi (circulation of goods among regions)
sen.e: Taking advantage of Hachiman-bori Canal's geographical advantage, Omi merchants adopted a trade scheme called 'Shokoku Sanbutsu Mawashi (circulation of goods among regions)' in which they shipped local goods (tatami straw mats, mosquito nets, rice, rice wine and others) via land and water and returned with goods from other regions, which in turn were shipped elsewhere, and through this cycle contributed to industrial development in various parts of the country.

Taking advantage of Hachiman-bori Canal's geographical advantage, Omi merchants adopted a trade scheme called 'Shokoku Sanbutsu Mawashi (circulation of goods among regions)' in which they shipped local goods (tatami straw mats, mosquito nets, rice, rice wine and others) via land and water and returned with goods from other regions, which in turn were shipped elsewhere, and through this cycle contributed to industrial development in various parts of the country.

sen.j: また、近江商人の商売哲学「三方よし（買い手よし、売り手よし、世間よし）」は、他国での商売を通じて生まれた概念である。
sen.e: The regional merchant culture gave birth to the "Sanpo-yoshi" principle ("good in three directions" meaning that commerce should not only benefit the buyer and the seller but also society as a whole) -- a business concept that emerged from the experiences of the merchants who engaged in trade with other regions of the country.

The regional merchant culture gave birth to the 'Sanpo-yoshi' principle ('good in three directions' meaning that commerce should not only benefit the buyer and the seller but also society as a whole) -- a business concept that emerged from the experiences of the merchants who engaged in trade with other regions of the country.

The regional merchant culture gave birth to the 'Sanpo-yoshi' principle ('good in three directions' meaning that commerce should not only benefit the buyer and the seller but also society as a whole) -- a business concept that emerged from the experiences of the merchants who engaged in trade with other regions of the country.

sen.j: 昭和になると、運河の機能を失った堀は、汚泥を掬い上げる「川ざわえ」が廃れ、川底にヘドロが堆積し、悪臭を放つようになった。
sen.e: In Showa Period, the practice of "kawa-zawae (river dredging)" to remove sludge disappeared with the decline of Hachiman-bori's importance as a canal and resulted in sludge sedimentation on the canal bed and foul odor in the area.

In the Showa Period, the practice of 'kawa-zawae (river dredging)' to remove sludge disappeared with the decline of Hachiman-bori's importance as a canal and resulted in sludge sedimentation on the canal bed and foul odor in the area.

In the Showa Period, the practice of 'kawa-zawae (river dredging)' to remove sludge disappeared with the decline of Hachiman-bori's importance as a canal and resulted in sludge sedimentation on the canal bed and foul odor in the area.

sen.j: 1970年（昭和45年）、地元自治会は堀の改修計画を市に陳情し、堀を埋め立てて公園と駐車場にする計画が立てられた。
sen.e: In 1970, the local community association petitioned the municipal government for a plan to renovate the canal, in which the canal was to be filled and turned into a park and parking space.
In 1970, the local community association petitioned the municipal government for a plan to renovate the canal, in which the canal was to be filled and turned into a park and parking space.
In 1970, the local community association petitioned the municipal government for a plan to renovate the canal, in which the canal was to be filled and turned into a park and parking space.

sen.j: しかし、近江八幡青年会議所は堀を近江八幡の誇りとして蘇らせようと、改修計画の見直しを迫り、八幡堀復活を求めて署名運動・自主清掃活動を行った。
sen.e: However, the Omihachiman Youth Chamber of Commerce sought to restore the canal as the pride of Omihachiman and pressed for reconsideration of the plan, organizing a petition drive and volunteer cleaning campaign aimed at the restoration of the canal.

However, the Omihachiman Youth Chamber of Commerce sought to restore the canal as the pride of Omihachiman and pressed for reconsideration of the plan, organizing a petition drive and volunteer cleaning campaign aimed at the restoration of the canal.

However, the Omihachiman Youth Chamber of Commerce sought to restore the canal as the pride of Omihachiman and pressed for reconsideration of the plan, organizing a petition drive and volunteer cleaning campaign aimed at the restoration of the canal.

sen.j: 1975年（昭和50年）、「よみがえる近江八幡の会」が設立され、堀の保存修景運動は、市民全体の運動へと展開した。
sen.e: In 1975, the Yomigaeru Omihachiman no kai (Association for Restoring Omihachiman) was formed, and the canal preservation and restoration movement grow in scale to involve the citizens at large.
In 1975, the 'Yomigaeru Omihachiman no kai (Association for Restoring Omihachiman)' was formed, and the canal preservation and restoration movement grow in scale to involve the citizens at large.
In 1975, the 'Yomigaeru Omihachiman no kai (Association for Restoring Omihachiman)' was formed, and the canal preservation and restoration movement grow in scale to involve the citizens at large.

sen.j: そして、1976年（昭和51年）、堀の全面浚渫工事が着工され、1979年（昭和54年）に工事が完成した。
sen.e: In 1976, full-scale dredging works started, and the project was completed in 1979.
In 1976, full-scale dredging works started, and the project was completed in 1979.
In 1976, full-scale dredging works started, and the project was completed in 1979.

sen.j: 1982年（昭和57年）、国土庁の「水緑都市モデル地区整備事業」に指定され、堀の石垣が復元され、堀沿いに遊歩道・親水広場が作られた。
sen.e: In 1982, the canal was named "City of Water and Greenery Model District Development Project," under which the canal's stone embankments were restored and pedestrian walkways and waterfront plazas were created.
sen.cmt: 水緑都市モデル地区整備事業: City of Water and Greenery Model District Development Project
sen.e: In 1982, the canal was named 'City of Water and Greenery Model District Development Project' supervised by National Land Agency, under which the canal's stone embankments were restored and pedestrian walkways and waterfront plazas were created.
sen.cmt: National Land Agency を追加しました。" " → ' '
sen.e: In 1982, the canal was named 'City of Water and Greenery Model District Development Project' supervised by National Land Agency, under which the canal's stone embankments were restored and pedestrian walkways and waterfront plazas were created.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）、「八幡堀を守る会」が結成され、会員による除草作業が行なわれるようになった。
sen.e: In 1988, the Group to Preserve Hachiman-bori Canal was formed, and its members engaged in weeding for improvement of the canal.
In 1988, the 'Group to Preserve Hachiman-bori Canal' was formed, and its members engaged in weeding for improvement of the canal.
In 1988, the 'Group to Preserve Hachiman-bori Canal' was formed, and its members engaged in weeding for improvement of the canal.

sen.j: 1992年（平成4年）、「八幡」として「新町通り」・｢永原町通り｣・「日牟禮八幡宮境内地」と共に国の重要伝統的建造物群保存地区に選定される。
sen.e: In 1992, the canal was designated part of Omihachiman City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Hachiman Buildings, together with Shinmachi-dori, Nagahara-cho dori and Himure-hachimangu Shrine.

In 1992, the canal was designated part of 'Omihachiman City Preservation District' for Groups of Historic Hachiman Buildings, together with 'Shinmachi-dori,' 'Nagahara-cho dori' and 'Himure-hachimangu Shrine.'

In 1992, the canal was designated part of 'Omihachiman City Preservation District' for Groups of Historic Hachiman Buildings, together with 'Shinmachi-dori,' 'Nagahara-cho dori' and 'Himure-hachimangu Shrine.'

sen.j: 水運が発達し、船での移動が盛んに行われた江戸を舞台とした時代劇の格好のロケ地になっている（『暴れん坊将軍』・『鬼平犯科帳』・『剣客商売』等）。
sen.e: The area has also become a favorite filming location for period dramas set in the Edo Period when boats were a popular mode of transportation and river and maritime shipping thrived. ("Abarenbo Shogun," "Onihei Hankacho," "Kenkyaku Shobai," etc.)

The area has also become a favorite filming location for period dramas set in the Edo Period when boats were a popular mode of transportation and river and maritime shipping thrived ("Abarenbo Shogun," "Onihei Hankacho," "Kenkyaku Shobai," etc.).

sen.e: 25 min. on foot from the North Exit of Omihachiman Station on JR Biwako Line or 8 min. on Omi Railway Bus (bound for Chomei-ji Temple) to Osugi-cho bus stop
